intro: Parasenecio firmus, commonly known as the rigid parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, often forming dense clusters. Parasenecio firmus is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique type of shrubland ecosystem.
